pr_title: Servicebus track 2 service bus sync sender client

timeline.bodyText:
This test doesn't need to be this complex. You can mock the ServiceBusSenderAsyncClient and then make sure the appropriate methods are called.
This is basically testing logic in ServiceBusSenderAsyncClient.
timeline.author: conniey
conniey

timeline.bodyText: These tests don't have to be public.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: I would double-check that you need these member variables, most if not all, of them can be removed.
timeline.author: conniey
conniey

timeline.bodyText: this can be simplified to verify(asyncSender).createBatch();
timeline.author: conniey
conniey

timeline.bodyText: You don't need all this logic. You can assert that the correct properties for the batch were passed to asyncClient. We assume asyncClient does the right thing
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: You don't need this. You just need to assert that the send(ServiceBusMessage) is called on the asyncClient. And same with the one below.
timeline.author: conniey
conniey
conniey

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    ServiceBusMessageBatch batch =  new ServiceBusMessageBatch(batchSize, null, null,
          
          
            
                    final ServiceBusMessageBatch batch = new ServiceBusMessageBatch(batchSize, null, null,
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: In Arrange, Act, and Assert, this line would be "Act". And the Line 135 would be "Assert"
timeline.author: conniey
